required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Cross-sectional, Observational Multicenter Study to Assess the Reasons for Choosing the 3-year Hormonal IUD and Level of IUDs Knowledge Among Women Aged 18 to 29 Years
clinical_study.official_title: A Cross-sectional, Observational Multicenter Study to Assess the Reasons for Choosing the 3-year Hormonal IUD and Level of IUDs Knowledge Among Women Aged 18 to 29 Years

brief_summary.textblock:
A cross-sectional, observational multicenter study to assess the reasons for choosing the 3-year hormonal IUD and level of IUDs knowledge among women aged 18 to 29 years. The study will be conducted in standard clinical practice conditions at public and private gynecology clinics and during a single study visit.
Approximately 1,000 women aged 18 to 29 years who have freely chosen the 3 year hormonal IUD as their contraceptive method will be included in the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Reason for choosing Jaydess as intrauterine device (IUD)
primary_outcome.description: The participants select the reason out of a given list of 15 possible reasons

primary_outcome.measure: Reason for switching to Jaydess if used another type of intrauterine device before
primary_outcome.description: The participants select the reason out of a given list of 10 possible reasons

primary_outcome.measure: Knowledge of Jaydess or other IUDs prior to the visit
primary_outcome.description: The participants select the reason out of a given list of 3 possible reasons

primary_outcome.measure: Is the first intrauterine device prescribed?
Person who encouraged the use of jaydess?
primary_outcome.description: The participants select the answer out of a given list of 5 possible people

secondary_outcome.measure: Reason for not using Jaydess or other intrauterine delivery system (IUD) before
secondary_outcome.description: The participants select the reason out of a given list of 12 possible reasons

secondary_outcome.measure: Uterine length as measured by ultrasonography

secondary_outcome.description: The participants select out of a given list of 20 options

secondary_outcome.measure: Has she had some birth vaginally? (Y/N)
Do you plan to have (more) children? (Yes/No/Unknown)
When she plans to have (more) children

arm_group.description: Women aged 18 to 29 years that use Jaydess for contraception

intervention.description: Intrauterine delivery system Jaydess (13.5 mg levonorgestrel)

study_pop.textblock: The study population will consist of women aged 18-29 years, who have freely chosen Jaydess for contraception after being adequately counseled and informed of all contraceptive options by their physician at a previous visit to the study visit in a routine clinical practice setting

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women aged 18 to 29 years.
- Women who decided to initiate treatment with a 3-year hormonal IUD for contraception after being adequately counseled and informed of all contraceptive options by their physician during a routine clinical visit, prior to the study visit (insertion visit).
- Women capable of reading and writing.
- Women who signed informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women currently participating in an interventional clinical trial.
- Prescription of the 3-year hormonal IUD for non-contraceptive medical reasons.
